message:
The Lebanese Electricity Company: The supply of electricity to the national grid was stopped all over Lebanon, including to the airport, the port of Beirut, the water pumps, etc.
The reason: the last production unit at the Zahrani power plant stopped operating due to a lack of fuel.

##
I will point out that these days there are only about four hours of electricity a day in the national grid in Lebanon and many in Lebanon rely on private generators and solar panels.

IDF: Earlier today, the IAF struck and eliminated the terrorist Hussein Ibrahim Kasseb, a commander in Hezbollah's Radwan Force, in the area of Tyre.

##
It can be assumed that this is the attack in Kadmous earlier today
Al Maghazi exodus

Gazans are evacuating from the Maghazi refugee camp in the center of the Gaza Strip following the instructions of the IDF spokesman.

Gaza sources are reporting in the last hour that gangs of thieves were caught breaking into the apartments of residents who were evacuating for the first time from their homes in the Maghazi refugee camp.
The apartments are still "full of good things" because this is the first evacuation of this area, where the IDF has yet to maneuver - a paradise for thieves in the Strip.

Senior Hamas official, Sami Abu Zahari, in a statement to the French news agency:
Biden's words that we are close to a ceasefire agreement are an illusion.

IDF: Following the sirens that sounded a short while ago in the area of Ayelet HaShahar in northern Israel, approximately 55 projectiles were identified crossing from Lebanon, some of which fell in open areas. No injuries were reported. As a result of the projectiles fired into Israel, multiple fires were ignited in the area and Israel Fire and Rescue Services are currently operating at the scene to extinguish them. 

Earlier today (Saturday), an IDF soldier was severely injured and another soldier was lightly injured this morning as a result of a projectile that crossed from Lebanon and fell in the area of Misgav Am. The soldiers were evacuated to a hospital for medical treatment and their families have been notified.
Lebanese channels report one dead in an Israeli UAV attack on a motorcycle in the Kadmous area in North Tyre, in South Lebanon.

Around noon the Lebanese Al Mayadeen: More than 40 rockets were launched from Lebanon towards the Galilee in two volleys.

Hezbollah in an official announcement:
Today, for the first time, we launched rockets at Kibbutz Ayelet HaShachar in response to last night's attack on Wadi el Kfour (in Nabatieh).

North of the Gaza Strip, one of the Gazans wrote sarcastically:

The bodies of the Gazan martyrs do not rot as is the case with ordinary people because of the high amount of preservatives in their bodies - as a result of the diet based on cans from the humanitarian aid.

China has decided to ban the export of the chemical element metallic antimony outside of China for reasons of national security.

The antimony, which causes the hardening of metal alloys, is an essential element in the military industries and is used for a wide variety of military applications: night vision equipment, explosive compounds, lights, infrared sensors and... nuclear weapons.

Although China holds "only" 32% of the world's antimony reserves, 80% of all global antimony processing takes place in China.
This is a blow to the American military industry.

Chinese military spokesman:
The US is the biggest nuclear threat to the world.

His words are said against the background of the statement of the American Secretary of Defense regarding the need to deepen the deterrence against the Chinese nuclear weapons arsenal.
The President of Iran: The US is at the forefront of threats to our country. We can deal with it.

Muhammad bin Zayed, the ruler of the United Arab Emirates came to demand the safety of the prime minister of the Taliban (Afghanistan) who is hospitalized in one of the hospitals in Abu Dhabi (United Arab Emirates).

The Palestinians report 15 deaths tonight in an attack on a shed belonging to the al-Ajala family in the a-Zuwayda area in the center of the Gaza Strip.

Among the dead, the father of the family, Sami al-Ajala.
The area that was attacked in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon as it appears this morning.

The Lebanese Almanar channel (affiliated with Hezbollah):
10 dead, including children and 3 seriously injured in an Israeli attack in the Wadi al Kfour area in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon.

##
According to other Lebanese sources, a "factory" was attacked and Syrian refugees are among the dead.

##
According to the IDF spokesman, a Hezbollah ammunition depot was attacked in Nabatieh.

A short time ago, the IDF spokesman in Arabic published another evacuation notice, this time for the residents of the Maghazi refugee camp in the center of the Gaza Strip, as marked on the map.
This is an area that has not been cleared before.

The pressure is increasing on the residents of the center of the Gaza Strip - in areas that the IDF has not yet maneuvered in since the beginning of the war.

The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza: The first confirmed case of polio has been located in the Gaza Strip.

##
How convenient for them this publication, at this time, a day after the UN called for a one-week ceasefire to vaccinate 640,000 Gazan children and after Hamas joined the call. Coincidence?

President Biden: I spoke with the ruler of Qatar and the Egyptian president about the great progress made in the Doha talks over the past two days.

I am optimistic about reaching a ceasefire agreement in Gaza. We have an opportunity.

Senior Hamas official Ghazi Hamed in an interview with the Al-Mayadeen channel about the ceasefire talks:

We expected the negotiations to reach this result.

Netanyahu spoke honestly when he said he would not stop the war. It was in the media.

The occupation set new conditions regarding the Philadelphi Axis after we previously agreed that Israel would withdraw from it.

The publication in the Wall Street Journal regarding an Israeli withdrawal from the Philadelphi axis is not true.

Netanyahu blew up the agreement from the beginning.

We will not allow an Israeli presence on any piece of land in the Gaza Strip.

Israel wants there to be a loophole in the agreement that would allow it to return to fighting.

Israel failed the Doha agreement and there was no progress.

The talk about negotiations, about coexistence with the occupation and about peace - is all a lie.
